s.text: We support a human life amendment to the Constitution and we endorse legislation to make clear that the Fourteenth Amendment's protections apply to unborn children."
We support a human life amendment to the Constitution and we endorse legislation to make clear that the Fourteenth Amendment's protections apply to unborn children."
We support a human life amendment to the Constitution and we endorse legislation to make clear that the Fourteenth Amendment's protections apply to unborn children."
We support a human life amendment to the Constitution and we endorse legislation to make clear that the Fourteenth Amendment's protections apply to unborn children."
One is the notion the late Lee Atwater called "the big tent."
This is an imaginative attempt to dress craven pragmatism as high principle, but it makes no sense.
If full human life begins at conception, then full human rights do too, including the right to equal protection of the laws.
Even Bill Clinton might have trouble executing this double-reverse flip-flop fib off the high board.
